g.text: At first, the bootstrap ID cert is used as the EST identity cert
[for creating and renewing EST identity cert]
Get current EST identity cert's private key
Create TLS client using key handle + PEM (using openssl-engine-ks)
Create CSR for new EST identity cert using key handle (using openssl-engine-ks)
Connect using TLS client and perform EST enrolment to get a new EST identity cert corresponding to the CSR
Import signed cert as the EST identity cert for future requests
[for creating and renewing device CA cert (if needed to mint other certs)]
Get current EST identity cert's private key
Create TLS client using key handle + PEM (using openssl-engine-ks)
Create CSR for new device CA cert using key handle (using openssl-engine-ks)
Connect using TLS client and send request for new device CA cert corresponding to the CSR
Import signed cert as the device CA cert
Wait for the device CA cert to be near expiry (active timer)
[for creating and renewing device identity cert]
[if user configured device identity to be obtained from EST]
Similar process as for device CA cert above
[if user configured device identity to be minted locally]
Get current device CA cert's private key
Create CSR for new device identity cert using key handle (using openssl-engine-ks)
Sign CSR using device CA cert
Import signed cert as the device identity cert
Get current device identity cert's private key
Create TLS client using key handle + PEM (using openssl-engine-ks)
Connect using TLS client and send provisioning request
Verify client cert against device identity CA
